title: 112_s631
content: The "Hydropower Renewable Energy Development Act of 2011" recognizes hydroelectric energy as renewable energy for federal programs and standards. It includes various sources of hydroelectric energy generation in the United States and provides a production tax credit for hydropower resources. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 recognizes hydropower production from facilities for taxable years. This includes other hydropower production facilities described in the code. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for hydropower facilities with specific criteria to qualify for tax benefits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to allow qualified hydropower facilities to receive tax benefits for incremental hydropower production from efficiency improvements or capacity additions placed in service between August 8, 2005, and January 1, 2014. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to provide tax benefits for qualified hydropower facilities for production between August 8, 2005, and January 1, 2014, including facilities described in subsection (c)(8)(C) and (D) after the enactment of the Hydropower Renewable Energy Development Act of 2011. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to extend the 10-year credit period for qualified hydropower facilities. The credit rate increase applies to electricity produced after the enactment of the Act. 5-year accelerated depreciation period for equipment producing electricity from marine renewables and hydropower. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include provisions for equipment converting marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy into usable energy, as well as qualified hydropower production. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after the enactment of this Act, specifically focusing on hydropower production.
